results.description:
Community focused on the Marketplace Lending and Peer to Peer Lending (P2P) space. The goal is to share experiences, advice, and tools for growing this asset class to help shape the very nature of next-generation financial services.

This group was created by Matt Burton, the CEO of Orchard Platform, as a way to develop a community of like minded individuals. Orchard has evolved organically from what began as a small circle of friends with unique perspectives and complementary skill sets, driven by the same interests, and a desire to make a difference in the alternative lending space. Orchard includes experts from both the financial and technology space. 

Orchard is an investment and analytics platform that is leading the future of the credit industry. Orchard supports marketplace lending by providing technical and operational efficiencies to help institutional investors, investment managers and loan originators connect and transact. Founded in New York City in 2013, Orchard focuses on building the systems and infrastructure that will allow marketplace lending to grow into a global financial market. Orchard enables institutional investors to scale their investment in the space by providing investment strategy, real-time execution and reporting, premier analytics, and access to supply. Orchard helps originators expand the credit landscape by connecting them to a diverse set of capital providers, and enables them to focus on making loans and giving borrowers more choices.
results.name: Marketplace Lending (Peer to Peer Lending)

Our seminary is academically substantial and spiritually grounded while adding the dimensions of personal growth and development. This specialized curriculum goes further into understanding and working with the energetic shift of consciousness which is happening right now on our planet. This discussion group will explore from the highest place of positive energy, light and tolerance: what it means to work with the energetic shift of consciousness - deep personal development and advanced spiritual practice in a new and different way - what it means to become a "Universal Human" as spoken about by Barbara Marx Hubbard, Futurist and World Leader - the mystical/energetic aspects of religions along with inner work - interfaith perspective through comparative religions, focusing on compassion, connection with community and the Inner Divine. results.description:
"80 percent of success is just showing up" - Woody Allen

New restaurants open daily. New people move here daily. Navigating a city of this size –connecting with those who share your tastes, within it– can be challenging. Whether you’re looking for romantic connections, or just to expand your social circles, or simply to share in the love of food and this great city... We’re here to help you TAKE A BITE.

The benefit:

  • Plans are made for you, all you do is show up
  • Introductions to more than one person.
  • Opportunity to meet someone romantically or simply expand your social circle. Each date will have men and women, if you do not find a romantic connection, you may find your next tennis partner.
  • Introduction to new restaurants.
  • No hassle billing. The bill at the end of each meal is paid individually. We have requested each restaurant to provide separate bills for each attendee. This results in no uncomfortable bill splitting. Guys no need to pick up the bill for a date you didn't click with. Girls no awkwardness if you don't see date #2 in your future.
  • Our eyes are on you! Our hosts not only ensure conversation is flowing and behavior is acceptable. They also keep their eyes open for potential matches. If John attends an event on Monday and Jane, who is PERFECT for John attends an event on Friday, we will suggest a dinner for John and Jane. The dinner will either be a group dinner or a one on one, depending on the preference of John and Jane.

Dining options include restaurant events specifically for a number of scenarios.

  • Singles looking to connect with like-minded single individuals
  • Couples looking to try new places & expand their social circles
  • Foodies, for food lovers looking to try new places, enjoy great food and company
results.name: FoodTryst

results.description:
We believe that to create better results in whatever we do….

We need to build better people. And to build better people, we need our business culture to support, encourage and reward the values and behaviors that lead to those results. We come together to learn about individual human dynamics and culture and their effects on building GREAT teams and organizations that, in turn, create GREAT results.

Specifically, we address questions like:

  • What are those values at the individual, team, and organizational levels that produce great software?
  • What behaviors do we want to see? What does a culture look like anyway?
  • How do we deliberately design cultures to produce high performance?

These are the topics we regularly discuss at our meetings. Our speakers come from all walks of life, all around the world, and share their experiences – both good and bad – around these topics.

So, if you are passionate about high performance and want to learn and share – then come join us!
results.name: Agile Culture New York

results.description:
Have you had a dream of running your own business with passion & purpose?

Have you ever felt unappreciated, underpaid or even worse not enjoying going to work?

Have you ever felt fearful financially or emotionally when thinking on you need to make a change but feel trapped & don't know how?

Have you ever dreamed of having a better life, full of excitment, purpose, & a knowing that your adding value to the world & getting paid really well for it, making a 6 or 7 digit annual salary doing what you're passionate about?

If you answered yes to any of the above questions then this group is definitely for you!

I decided to start this group because as a coach, seminar leader, and successful entrepreneur I noticed so many people including myself at a point in time struggle financially & emotionally knowing where we work is not who we are.

The purpose of this group is to ignite passion & hope, inspire & support members to create & share there dreams on paper so they know the direction they'd like to go as well as how to proceed.

You'll become aware of the freedom on SO many levels that you can create when you begin to focus your energies on your dream. You'll have the support from myself & the amazing team of members that want to succeed with you!

Throughout these Meetups I'll be teaching you the processes on how to begin your business without any risk. You'll learn the amazing techniques, tools, and processes to build momentum & desire.

What gives me the right? I, who at one time was borderline bankrupt, a financial mess, miserable, & hopeless that I'd ever be able to change, am now living a life I once only dreamed of! From building companies from scratch, selling them for hundreds of thousands of dollars, to retiring in my twenties, to becoming a millionaire, & failing more than most people would probably ever admit, I can't wait to share the secrets I've learned over the years.

Are you ready to decide once in for all that you deserve more. Are you ready to learn & implement these amazing concepts into your life so you too can be on the road to freedom? Aren't you worth it?

Attending this meetup could seriously & possibly be the best decision you've ever made in your life! I'm SO excited to mentor & facilitate sharing amongst each other.

Lori Childs- Organizer

results.description:
This meetup is for people who are enthusiastic about capitalism as a system. Libertarians, market-oriented Democrats, Republicans, and Independents are welcome.

This is not a Tea-Party meetup. We do not support "starve the beast" as a political strategy, and feel that should significant tax cuts come, they should be after we have been running a budget surplus for years, sufficient to pay down the national debt to less than 70% of GDP. Tax increases should not be off the table.

This meetup is about economics and politics, but only politics that relate to economics.

Social and religious issues are off-topic unless they relate to economics.

Investment strategies may be discussed, but they are not the central theme of this meetup.

While the soul of this meetup is Libertarian, this is not a Libertarian Party meetup, partly because the US constitution usually dooms 3rd parties to obscurity, and partly because we want to be more pragmatic and less ideologically pure than the Libertarian Party.

Topics we would like to discuss:

  • Why did the mortgage meltdown happen -- was it "excessive deregulation", or was it "just a bubble bursting"? If it was a bubble bursting, can regulation prevent bubbles?
  • Is it reasonable to expect people in government to be so much smarter than the market that they can accurately perceive bubbles and take corrective measures before the market has figured out that a bubble is happening?
  • Ben Bernanke says that the bond market currently overestimates the government's willingness to bail out a big bank in the future, and he says the government now has tools to wind down a large organization that didn't exist in 2008. Should we believe him?
  • Some types of regulation are clearly bad. What types of regulation are good?
  • Do we need banks that are big enough to pose systemic risk? Or should we impose a "systemic risk tax" to penalize banks for being too big, so that they will voluntarily split themselves into smaller organizations?
  • Is growing inequality a problem if poverty is not increasing and median income is not declining?
  • Which is the worse sin: greed or envy?
  • Incumbents usually want stimulus, while the opposition usually screams bloody murder about the deficit. Should we opt for more stimulus now, or austerity, or are we currently making the right trade off?
  • You may love or hate Obamacare, but everyone agrees it won't do anything to contain our country's rampant medical inflation. What should be done to address this problem?
  • Economic Liberals, like those who run the Tenement Museum on the LES, often point to conditions in the 19th century and claim "that is where unbridled capitalism would take us". How did people's living conditions in the 19th century compare to their living standards before that? Do we owe our improved standard of living to politicians, union organizers, and regulators, as these people would claim, or to the inventors and industrialists who made dramatic increases in productivity possible?
  • Dodd-Frank: pros and cons?
  • The cost of college has been increasing much faster than inflation. The "US News and World Report"'s annual ranking of colleges actually rewards schools for spending more money per pupil. Many students are graduating so far in debt they are unlikely be debt-free before they are 30. This whole problem undermines social mobility. Why is this happening and what can be done about it?
  • China's gradual adoption of market reforms after the death of Mao and the discrediting of the Soviet economic model around 1990 have made market economics the only game in town. This has brought a flood of good news from economies that 20 years ago were deemed hopeless. Living standards in China and India have increased dramatically, and there are 3 cellphones for every four Africans.
results.name: Fans of Capitalism

results.description:
These are not your typical events around art, culture, law, politics, and technology because we address these issues within the context of the cannabis/marijuana community. Counterculture icons will speak alongside political heavyweights and policy makers alike. Networking will be encouraged, connections will be made, and policies changed because of the events we hold. 

Events may have stand alone speakers, TED style talks, panels, or even debates. We will be creating local initiatives to decriminalize and legalize marijuana in the City of New York as well as creating committees to reach out to local authorities and community leaders to let them know about the needs of the local cannabis community. Get ready New York, the Times They Are A Changin.

Cannabis Society is a 501(c)(7) social club corporation and pride ourselves as being the first cannabis country club in the nation dedicating our efforts to develop events around cannabis and its medicine, recreational, commercial, and industrial uses.  We have chapters additional to NYC in Boston, Denver, and San Francisco.

results.description:
The process of building software and the way engineering teams are structured to deliver it are going through a process of transformative change. There is probably no clearer example of this than in the world of startup engineering. How else could Instagram have built & operated a system that ran on cross-platform devices and scaled to 30M users with only a small team of engineers? But how are are startup teams like Instragram organized? And what processes do they use to design, deliver and maintain their platforms? 

Drawing on the experience of top startup engineers, this group teaches the core principles of startup engineering. Our talks explore real-world scenarios and tested methodologies that startup engineers will learn from as they work to build their own platforms and the teams that deliver them.

I love to introduce people to new neighborhoods and explore their past, present and future and also welcome the opportunity to learn from others. With the fast-pace of life here it is easy to overlook the hidden treasures and iconic buildings that we pass by every day. results.description:
Welcome, Real Estate Professionals & Investors.

I am changing this group to focus on real estate development. I am a CPA by trade but I decided to learn and trade in real estate after one of the real estate seminar.

The seminar is heavily advertised on radio (at least in NYC) where you get to attend 2 hour demo for free and at the end there is a push for more expensive paid seminars. I opted not to go for the paid seminar however. The only thing I walked away from that seminar: Real Estate related investments have produced more millionaires than any other trade.

Since that seminar, I spent countless hours to put together a plan. Unlike, other investment groups Real Estate will require a complete team of professionals and bunch of investors.

Currently I am looking forward to connect with:

1. Real Estate Brokers (No sales people yet)

2. Mortgage Brokers or bankers.

3. Attorney

4. Contractors (GC, Plumbing, Electricians)

5. If you feel you have passion to join team, you are welcome as well.

I don't really care if you have 20 years experience or just starting out in your field. As long as you are able to come up to the plate and hit a home run, you are welcome. I think it's important that all professionals get their chance instead of being shut out by so called 'Experience'. All we need is 'Can do' attitude, intelligence and some money.

Please join and suggest! Let's all make some $$$.
results.name: New York: Real Estate Professionals & Investors

results.description:
This group brings together business people who have a real passion for utilizing New Media to create business growth, as well as a desire to stay on top of the latest ever-evolving technologies and marketing methods.

Well, what IS New Media?  ...boush put it nicely:

New Media Definition: New media is the fusion of traditional media and communications with Internet technology. More than what it is, new media defines itself by what it is not. It is not traditional media: radio, television, print and film. Instead, new media is digital. It's interactive. It's on your computer, your phone, your next new gadget.

New Media Marketing: New Media Marketing is the challenge and the opportunity of marketing on digital channels. It's about marketing on a two-way street with consumers. It's about metrics--making business decisions based on the amazing data new media marketing provides. It's about Internet-driven technologies like blogs, RSS, Web video productions, and podcasts. It's about email, organic & paid search, social media, mobile marketing and more!

Each meetup will provide networking opportunities as well as an expert sharing the latest tips and tricks in his or her specialized area of New Media. The topics, experts and venue will change each month.

Are you an expert in one of these areas? Perhaps you can join us and share your knowledge and experience...

results.description: There isn't space to put all I want in the title, but I want to create this group for adult children who feel marginalized by their family structure, by one or both parents, or who feel that they have a parent who doesn't understand them, a parent who exhibits extreme favoritism toward a sibling, or a parent who is self-absorbed, selfish, or narcissistic. I want the group to be a private, safe and healthy place to support each other. Humans need to feel connected with others and loved and cared for by others to thrive, and, when we don't get this from our family units, we may suffer. I am not striving to create a group where we aggravate our difficulties by discussing only what's wrong, but where we have a group that feels like home, where we can offer each other coping strategies and encouragement to lead full lives even if we sometimes feel something is missing. I will strive to keep the group as private as possible. For that reason, I am not revealing much personal information unless you join. Thank you for respecting that.
results.name: Adult Children of Narcissists

results.description:
As basic as playing the beautiful game, pick-up soccer, "pelada" -the game played everywhere, by everyone in an organized fun way.

 

Beautiful Game FC was started so we could play pickup soccer and also collect for soccer specific charities. Our first accomplishment – though rather small, was giving a meager sum to the roundstarfoundation.org as two coaches went and set up clinics to coach kids and also teachers who want to lead community teams in Zimbabwe.

We are building our charity work as Beautiful Game grows. So we ask for $2 donations per game to cover our costs.

Meetup is a great website that connects all of us soccer lovers but in case you did not know. It is not free. Meetup charges $45 every 3 months to use it. Simple math= 3 months, goes into 12 months, 4 times. That’s $180 per year to use Meetup.

We also provide top quality gear. We play with 6 foot Pugg nets, cones, a kick-ass (pun intended) FIFA authentic Bola Official ball of Brasil ($150) and not so world class bibs. We hope to get nicer bibs in the future.

We want to keep our current schedule of Mon-Wed-Fri 1pm kickoffs but I'm not able to make it every time as I have coaching scheduling conflicts some days. So Mpande is running the Meetups on the days I can't. And he will set up the pitch so you can all play, but also, he will be collecting. Please don’t make him beg for a dollar. He truly does this for the love of the game, but lugging 6 foot goals on the subway is no fun.

If your attitude is like ‘F*ck this shit no way I’m paying for pickup soccer in NYC!’ that’s cool there are many other soccer Meetup groups. But if you are like I like what they do, but have no job, hence I play soccer in the middle of the day during the work week, and I can’t afford $2- talk to us and that is cool. We understand. It’s all about helping those that could use it. And if you are broke and playing soccer, I call that therapeutic.

Best,

Matt
results.name: Beautiful Game FC

results.description:
Hi everyone,  I hope you'll join us in the practice of being mindful.

Being mindful is simply defined as a process of bringing your attention, in an intentional way, to the present moment with an attitude of openness and acceptance.

Mindfulness is an opportunity to slow down, to embrace the moment, and to develop self-compassion. Learn and practice mindfulness techniques that can be easily incorporated into your daily life. You will learn techniques including: breathwork, guided and unguided meditations and emotional and sensory awareness exercises. And learn habits to help you remember from moment to moment.

From these practices, you will find more clarity of thought, action and emotional responses in yourself and in your relationships with others.  Find out what everyone is talking about and find out more about yourself.
results.name: Mindfulness: a place to be, in Brooklyn

results.description:
Our team - Columbia CC - is one of the fastest growing & most diverse teams in NY. We have players from all over the world - NZ, SA, Ind, Pak, SL, WI and even USA & Canada. We won the Saturday league last year - which had teams from all over the tri-state area. We haven't lost a single league game this year so far (knock on wood). We practice in the city on Wednesdays and Fridays - 6-8am on 53rd st & 11th ave. We also play friendlies and some Sunday games with teams from the Commonwealth Cricket League. At the core of it all - we have a great group of guys that play the game in the right spirit and enjoy playing with each other.

The club primarily plays 35 over cricket on Saturdays during the summer, but also takes part in Twenty20 matches as well as the annual two day first-class match against St. Columbus CC in Newport, Rhode Island. The club promotes fairness and prestige for passionate cricketers looking for the perfect balance of fun and competitive cricket.

results.description:
The purpose of this meetup group is to create a helpful community for new models who are interested in pursuing modeling as a career or hobby. As the first meetup group in the NYC area dedicated to models, we hope to bring informative events and networking opportunities to our members.

Topics that will be covered at events include:

  • Starting out as a model (those who have an interest but are unsure of where to begin)
  • Developing a portfolio
  • Marketing & self promotion

We will have industry related experts discuss and share tips on aspects such as:

  • How to choose a photographer
  • Pros & cons of TF vs paid work
  • Whether signing with an agency is right for you
  • Spotting scams and shady work

This meetup group is just taking off and we hope that you will be a part of the start of a successful community! Join us on Facebook (250+ members) too!

**THIS GROUP IS OPEN TO MODELS (FEMALE) ONLY**

To ensure that members have a helpful, relevant and professional experience, we are limiting the group to FEMALE members who MODEL. Photographers, MUAs and other industry professionals will be contacted to speak or to participate in future networking events.

results.description:
NEW YORK SOCIETY OF MIXOLOGY

 

We ameliorate 8 million lively souls, in the most legendary city in the world, with a single sip. Our cocktails crafted with heart and hand. The society is a meet up established for aspiring bartenders, sommliers, flair bartenders, mixologist, and cocktail chefs. Other restaurant professionals are welcome.

 

This community was originally devised as a career support group for bartenders searching for a job in the food and hospitality field. Yet, we want to expand to be a wing-man through your entire evolution. The society offers resources and experiences for you and by you. Each member will find themselves being an enthusiastic and loyal contributor.

 

What could you expect as a member?

 

LABS

 

Hands-on experience resources like guest bartending and educational workshops to help you grow as professional.

 

STUDIES

 

tudy Groups to get feedback on your resume, interview skills, and job search strategy. Additionally, we'll keep you abreast with your mental cocktail Rolodex. So you'll never have to go fishing for the cocktail book when some one ask for Pisco Sour. Gush over collectively esteemed 'book of the month" that is related to enriching ourselves as professionals and/or human beings.

 

MIXERS

 

Bond with pros just like you while you savor refreshments . We'll have discussions on hot topics at the forefront of the community's mind, give away loot, enjoy entertainment, and/or chitchat our phenomenal guest speakers.

 

WALKS

 

Job seekers will benefit from group job search efforts. Some establishments may not advertise their vacant positions because they expect walk-ins. We will walk to various neighborhoods to accomplish that.

 

TOURS

 

Join us for group outings to distilleries, venues, breweries, wineries, related educational organizations, food and drink festivals locally and abroad.

 

HOPS

 

Bar hops, wine bars, restaurants, and private parties at lounges! Titillating cocktails at the Oral Fix bar, reservations at Please Don't Tell, sip South African Sauvignon Blanc at Ardesia and "Hell Yeah, We want fries with that!" at Saxon +Parole. We'll explore the best city has to offer and the hidden treasures of New York. We'll picked the brains of the most respected bartenders of our time.

 

So pull up a stool, and stay awhile. We're family now.
results.name: The New York Society of Mixology

results.description:
The Grief Recovery Method® Outreach Program is an Action Program for Moving Beyond Death, Divorce, and Other Losses.

People say you have to let go and move on in your life, but they don’t tell you what you need to do to accomplish that.

Your feelings are normal and natural. Whether your loss is from: • Death • Divorce or end of a relationship • Loss of a career • Loss of trust • Loss of faith • Loss of safety • Loss of health

The Grief Recovery Method® Outreach Program not only makes that possible, but provides partnerships and guidance to ensure that it happens.

Please consider joining a group or inquire about individual sessions soon to get on the way to recovery.

We need to keep Meetup members in the platform- that means that once they arrive to meetup.com, a group page or open the apps, they need to register, then we need to make sure they join at least one group and RSVP.

Peaceful, Compassionate, Empathetic Guided Meditation in East Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Join us for a deeply relaxing meditation, including peaceful sound therapy, Reiki Healing Energy and a guided journey into your inner peace.

Be Balanced Meditation is located in a downstairs apartment of a private home with it's own entrance. It is across from Cooper park. Parking is located across the street and train location is in walking distance. We are a small place but we can hold up to 10 people at a time. Our location is cozy and comfortable.

We are a family run business and care about everyone who joins us. Our goal is to help you find peace and let go of stress, anxiety and anger. All meditation are free but donations are appreciated.

Please arrive at least 5 minutes before the meditation schedule time. Each meditation runs from 50 to 70 minutes depending on the theme. We have mats and chairs so you don't have to bring anything. Dress comfortably and enjoy your stay.

Please show up if you RSVP and visit our website www.bebalancednyc.com

Activities will range from a broad spectrum: cultural, outdoors, music, travel, sporting events, pub trivia, foodie and film nights, festivals, walking tours, and the like.   We are always looking for new activities and welcome suggestions for future meetups from our members.

results.description:
Calling people who are: Fun, Vivacious and Effervescent about life and love to travel and explore NJ as if you haven’t lived here your whole life. Lets geek out and go for tours, or go wander around a town you have never visited …snow tubing, river tubing …anything that does not require a lot of skill, but is fun :)

We are looking to expand our group with some fun loving, funny, great people! Age is really just a number…but it would be nice to have group in their 30’s to 40's. (Can take late 20's as well) And it would be a major perk if you happen to live in the 732 area code. If not, hey...it’s worth traveling to meet good people. Girls, guys…the more the merrier, lets plan some cool stuff!

New Members are ALWAYS WELCOME at ANY Meet up event we host. We do not wait for certain events...our group is your group. We are a welcoming bunch xoxox

If you don’t see an event posted that works for you and you would like to host an event, just contact the organizer with details.

This is a group geared towards singles, but please don’t let that deter you! This is NOT a dating group. This is NOT a group that is about finding your soul mate. This IS a group about getting together with people who want to go out and have a great time. This group offers us the opportunity to enjoy the things we love with other likeminded people.

From time to time, you may see LMMU (last minute meet up) or what this group has coined as a "post and go". This is when an organizer finds free time and wants to get a group together fast- this can be a great way to meet some of the group in small doses. But if many people is what you prefer, then that is awesome too!

We can be your Wing-men/Wing-women...how great it is to know you can go hang out somewhere and already have a crew to hang out with? Let's help each other, and have a great time all at the same time.

Groups are not about numbers, but engagement - actually coming out, being part of us, ya know? It's easy to sit at a computer and watch life pass you by, maybe a small investment will keep someone from joining if they really don't plan on meeting up w/ meet up :) (the whole point, btw)

Meet up charges the organizer of meet up groups $90.00 every 6 months. Member dues will help pay for organizer dues, as well as hopefully help get all members out with the group/more engaged and participating. Be proud you are here in Jersey's 732, be proud you are single, and most importantly, get out and LIVE!

We also accept offers of sponsorship, please contact Dion, Dawn, Heather, or any "732" Leader/Organizer/Event Organizer, etc. for more information. Please know the incentive you would be willing to offer the group.

Many members have asked how they can tell people about the group quickly - just tell them to Google the following - Single in the 732 and we will pop up. Or, our brand new quick link: http://www.meetup.com/732peeps/ 

***IMPORTANT INFORMATION*** liability and release

By signing up as a member of the "30 & 40 Something Single Peeps in the "732" and/or attending an event,(as a member, guest or minor) you and your guests or minors (if applicable) accept and fully understand and will adhere to the fact that any event can come with risk and/or harm, and you fully assume all risks associated with such participation, including travel to and from the event.  You agree to be responsible for your own safety and equipment; and realize that waterway conditions, obstacles, weather, your own skill level, and even peoples personalities, choices, and tolerance levels can change at any time. You and any guest(s), minor(s) etc., agree to hold all Organizers and/or Sponsors harmless in the event of the following, but not limited to, equipment or vehicle loss or damage, emotional stress,  job loss, driving or licensing (of any kind) loss, injury or death.

Know when to say when regarding any consumption of alcohol and all interpersonal connections, both friendly, business related and/or romantic/sexual involvement.  You agree to be self protecting, and self aware, as background checks are not run on members of meet-up.

Drug use, sale, or dispensation of any kind is not allowed within this group.

Update : July 2015 - Would like to work on more sponsorships.. the more followers the easier that will be for us to bring in $ for free drinks and food. 

Please follow/like us on our new pages via Facebook and also google plus:

https://plus.google.com/u/0/b/1005150945965... 

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Seventhreetwo-Peeps/691659957570628 

Group was founded by "D-Roc" April of 2013, and first Meetup occurred June of 2013. In the words from our "Godfather"(mother's) favorite singer she wants us to "Measure up our wealth in friends and family".
results.name: Peeps of "732"

MEMBERSHIP DUES: $10.00 per year.

Please note: Due to the cost of organizing the group, a small Annual Membership Dues of $10.00  are required from all members. This fee  is a contribution towards the monthly fee to Meetup.com and for other cost associated with organizing  events. (ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP DUES ARE PAID ONCE PER YEAR AT YOUR 1ST EVENT).

PLEASE NOTE: THERE IS  A TRIAL PEROID FOR ALL NEW MEMBERS. AFTER THE TRIAL PEROID, IF YOU DON'T  SUBMIT YOUR ANNUAL DUES, YOU'LL BE REMOVED FROM THE GROUP.

Thanks for your support.

JOIN TODAY!

Best regards

Laurel
results.name: THE ACTIVITY  GROUP  45+ NYC

results.description:
We are the career chasers, the changemakers, the entrepreneurs, the ambitious multitaskers....basically we are the ones either making things happen or on our way. However, in our busy lives, it's important not to forget about our health. Who doesn't want to be healthy? So this is the group for you to hit 2 birds with 1 stone!

Here we create a community for professional networking to not only share ideas, create commerce and success together in business, but also to create a community to share ideas on health, nutrition, and fitness. Who has time to sit there all day, read a billion books on health & nutrition, and sort through their validity? (By the way if you are that person, then that's great too). Since most of us don't, we should just bounce ideas off each other. The good news is amongst the variety of professionals in the group, we already have some healthcare/fitness professionals in this group. The better news is we welcome more, and if you're not one, then that's why you should join.

We will have a variety of meetups such as happy hour networking, different physical activities such as yoga, running, rock climbing, to social activities such as bowling, paint balling, bbq's, and even doing health challenges. And of course, we are always open to feedback because there is always room for improvement.
results.name: Healthy Lifestyle for Busy Professionals

results.description: This group is for anyone who wants to store food for a rainy day. I will teach you to store 1 to 2 months of food for 25 years. while having drinks. Let's have fun and not worry because we are covered.

results.description: This meetup group is intended to bring together bioinformatics software developers, life scientists and entrepreneurs interested on the applications of cloud computing to the analysis of large-scale genome sequencing datasets. We welcome members from academia, non-profits or industry, who would like to discuss research ideas, software, explore ventures in cloud computing / genome sequencing technologies, or simply build a network with others that are enthusiastic for the potential offered by the intersection of these two technologies.
results.name: Bioinformatics and Cloud Computing NYC

results.description:
Middle Eastern Tech Entrepreneurs is a group of visionary Middle Eastern technologist who are actively working or looking to create their own startup and want to find a place to harvest connections, and gain experience from established serial entrepreneurs as well as leaders in the financial and business world.

The group is also open for anyone who wants to expand his technology to the untapped Middle Eastern echosystem and would like to learn the best way to penetrate the market.

As the tech scene in the Middle East starts to boom, many organizations launched initiatives to harvest young entrepreneurs and provide the support needed to grow the next generation of visionaries and market leaders. METE provides a bridge between the US, Canada and the middle east by funneling members through a channel of mentoring and support to school them in their business idea and expose them to possible investors or strategic partners.


Q- Do i have to be Middle Eastern to join the group?
 A- No. Everyone is welcomed to join.

Q- I do not have a tech startup, can i join the group?
 A- Yes. You can get a lot from the group by networking with other like minded people, learn about the tech echo-system in the US vs the ME and possibly join a future company or find a co-founder.

Q- I would like to become a group sponsor or supporter, who do i contact?
 A- You can contact one of the group organizers listed on the left column of the meetup group.
results.name: Middle Eastern Tech Entrepreneurs

results.description:
3 Hour Seminars addressing all phase of the music business including A&R, Bookings, Publishing, Branding, Psychology of Music, Music Production and much more.

Each seminar is moderated by Gold and Platinum Music Producer and former head of A&R for EMI Music group, John McCracken.

Each seminar will have an industry veteran guest speaker experienced in each of these areas.

This is an open forum of Q&A and a great way to network with like minded musicians.

results.description:
A Tribe Called Love [for NYC Couples]

Calling all 20 something and 30 something, committed couples in NYC! This group is for those of you who still love to get out and have fun while meeting other great couples and strengthening your relationship at the same time.

We believe that dating doesn't have to stop after dating! Too often, date night is the first thing to go out the window when couples settle down and get comfortable. We're here to help NYC couples keep date night fresh, fun and exciting!

Our goal is to host at least two MeetUps a month. And although we already have a growing queue of activities for the next few months, we definitely encourage suggestions from you guys. We want to make sure you guys are all getting the best experience you can from this group, so don't be shy.

Go ahead and hit that Join button and let's have a good time!
results.name: A Tribe Called Love [for Couples]

results.description: This is a group for Trust & Safety and Policy pros on the NYC tech scene. In the Soul Empowerment event we shall gain specific information and skills for deep soul navigation. This will illuminate your unique paths to practical self mastery.

results.description:
Are you searching for fun and uplifting activities that will support your health, happiness, and well-being? Have you tried different doctors, practitioners, or therapies that didn't seem to work for you? Are you afraid to try something new, unsure if it's going to work or don't know enough about it? Are you seeking inspiration and help on your healing journey? Are you looking to meet others that share your interests and support you along the way?

The Community of Healing is about bringing those together who are seeking Emotional, Physical, & Spiritual Healing. Our goal is to introduce and educate you on different healing modalities so you can find what resonates with you on your own healing journey. Together we can explore different pathways of Healing.

Join us for events that nourish the mind, body, and spirit. Events will include: Meditation, Introductions to different Healing modalities, Nature walks/hiking, drum circles, dance, Reiki and Energy work, Yoga, Volunteering, Nutrition, Comedy shows and Motivational movies.

All ages are welcome. Some events will be gender specific and will be noted.

Let's heal ourselves and help support each other!!!

Quote: “We're all just walking each other home.” - Ram Dass :-)

results.description:
We are a group of cyclist who love to ride through the parks and on the trails of the Bronx and Westchester enjoying the outdoors and the company of others. When a meet  up is posted, their is a starting location and a destination. There is no pressure,you ride at your own pace and stop when you want to take a break, but as a group we try to stay together and enjoy the wonderful scenery when riding the trails.

We are not a professional organization, just a group who has a shared interest in cycling and enjoys the outdoors. When you RSVP "yes" for a event, you agree to be responsible for your own safety and equipment, and understand you may not hold anyone liable for accidents, injuries or events.

results.description:
Welcome to Let's Read Chamber Music Group. This Meetup Group is to create an opportunity for BOTH professionals and amateur music lovers to share music and socialize.

Please don't be intimidated if you are not ready to be on the Carnegie Hall this afternoon. I also ask professional musicians not to discriminate non-professionals. They are the future of classical music. It is our responsibility to continue to keep their interest and support in our art form.

Hope to see you and to make music with you soon!

 

Yoon Lee

Whether you're in advertising, branding, content creation, design, interactive, public relations, social media or any other "amplifying" profession, there are purpose-driven companies and organizations that need our help. Join us... and have a chance to meet that special someone. This group is for people who are open to dating out of their race and also dating within their race.. Black, White, Indian, Asian, and, Hispanic..all races....Basically no discrimination...Looking to meet some great people...so join me and we can have fun together and make this a successful group. topics.name: Make New Friends, from all Walks of Life
Night Life, Social, Movies, Fun & Games Night
Dining Out, BBQs, Food Fairs, Happy Hour and More

results.description:
LIFE IS AN ECHO. What you send out – comes back. What you sow – you reap. What you give – you get. What you see in others – exists in you. Do not judge – so you will NOT be judged. Radiate and give LOVE – and Love comes back to you. ~ Zig Ziglar

It's not happy people who are thankful, it is thankful people who are happy. ~ Unknown

What is LIFE OUT LOUD?

Our philosophy is simple ... be positive, inclusive, supportive and really enjoy the moments and memories we are building together.

Life is too short NOT to meet new people, make new friends, do something different, scream at the top of your lungs for no reason, commit random acts of kindness just for a smile and REALLY enjoy all that you do. In our group, you will meet and make new friends; you may eat a type of food you have never even heard of before; you could spend a day hiking in the beautiful wooded countryside (or maybe even do that same hike at night under a full moon); you can learn more about the New York Tri-State area through a tour or two; you will feel good about yourself when you help others at our volunteer events; you might learn to meditate, do yoga or tai chi; you can even face your fears with your new friends on exciting, adrenaline pumping adventures.

We are a group of open-minded, fun, positive, friendly, respectful, and supportive people who come from all walks of life.  No matter what your background, we want to meet you.  We want you to meet each other. We all have value as human beings, so let’s share that value with one another. The more diverse our group is, the more fun we will all have!!

So, read the rest, check out and agree to the Legal Disclaimer and Policies, and then join us to make new, lasting friendships and live LIFE OUT LOUD!

Who Are The Organizers:

There is no one organizer of LOL.  The group is run as a committee.  The LOL Organizers are friends that know, care about, and trust each other. We all endeavor to welcome you with open arms and come to know and care about YOU as much as we do for one another.  All the organizers and hosts have a shared vision for this group and share a desire to make new friends and provide an awesome time for everyone that comes to the events.   But, we all maintain that the strength of the group is YOU, the members!!

Our Events:

We do events throughout the five boroughs of New York City and beyond.  Our events range from a simple walk in the park, to flying through a canopy of trees on a zipline, to trying out new cuisines, to walking through the streets as a zombie and much more.  We may even spend an entire weekend away, either hiking/camping or going on a getaway.  The events will range in the number of attendees allowed, dependent upon what type of event.  If the event will involve alcoholic beverages, you must be 21 or older to RSVP to that event.

Don't worry about coming out alone, that's what most of us have done and do ... we'll make sure that you feel welcome, have fun and hopefully go home having had a memorable time. You can get started by browsing our Past Events and checking Our Calendar for upcoming events.

 

PLEASE READ AND AGREE TO OUR LEGAL DISCLAIMER AND POLICIES IN THE PAGES SECTION BEFORE SIGNING UP.
results.name: ! Life Out Loud !

topics.name: Enhancing the Lives of our Pets and Other Pets
fun times- good meals- and new friends!

results.description:
We are a Pet-Friendly Group of Men & Women who wish to reach out to make new friends. Let's exchange stories, ideas, info, and be there to support each other.  Either you've had a pet in the past, have one now, or are planning to get one in the future.

At first, the main focus will be on our own pets as we brag about them over lunch or dinner and get to know each other.  Then we'll attend some Community Events such as: Pet Expos, Fundraising, Volunteering, Bingo to benefit a rescue group, the Zoo, Aquariums, and anything Pet related that comes up (or not.)

People w/ pets are trustworthy, loving, responsible, friendly, kind, have knowledge to share, & can help out each other--by their past experiences or professional background, etc.  Let's all come together & meetup!

**NO-SHOW POLICY:  After two 'NO SHOWS,' you will be removed from the group. If your plans change at the last min please text me so I am aware of it--my cell # is always posted.

Let's make this group one of the best, most active, new, social groups out there by participating in several activities, providing feedback, and offering new suggestions and ideas which I am always open to.  Thank you for joining us, and 'Welcome!'  :-)
results.name: FRIENDS & PETS IN NASSAU AND BEYOND!

results.description:
This group is for anyone ages 35 and up who are interested in receiving social supports with various aspects of life. The purpose of the group is to connect likeminded individuals to serve as a catalyst in assisting one another on the path of support and healing. Our group will be facilitated by the group organizer and will meet two to four times a month.

With the organizer’s guidance, members will have access to resources and obtain ideas for developing an ideal life path. Topics will vary and evolve according to the social support needs of members. Events will take place in public areas such as libraries, parks, restaurants and local coffee shops.

Discussions in this environment are by no means a substitute for counseling or psychotherapy. It is merely a humble beginning for members to discuss an array of support topics with peers without judgement.

To ensure that our group flourishes, members must maintain a high level of respect and positivity toward one another.

Let's get together for frank to lighthearted discussions about everyday life ups and downs. Hopefully as a result of these discussions members will begin to finally live a Golden Life!

 

There will be nominal fee for two out of four event sessions.
results.name: Golden Life Path (Multi- Social Support Group)

results.description: This group is designed for coaches, therapists and just people in general who are interested in elevating their own lives and/or the lives of others around them through the principles of Family Constellation Therapy. Family systems and past generational trauma and events can and do affect us today in Love & Relationships, Career & FInances and Health & Wellbeing. Learn what dynamics are yours, and which belong to those in the past, so you can put your best foot forward in all areas of life. Group will include discussion, coaching, faciliating, exercises, meditation, journaling, and other activities designed for freedom and optimum success.
results.name: Family Constellation Therapy for a Happy & Successful Life!

results.description:
“I am a lover of what is, not because I'm a spiritual person, but because it hurts when I argue with reality.” ― Byron Katie, Loving What Is: Four Questions That Can Change Your Life"
The work is a simple and powerful  way of self inquiry that transforms stress, conflict and irritation into peace, love and connection. Please join us and fill your heart with love and compassion.

The group is led by Olga Berg, Certified Facilitator of The Work www.olgaberg.me
results.name: The Work of Byron Katie Manhattan UWS

results.description:
The New Jersey iPad and iPhone Users Group is long gone. We continue as part of our parent group:

The New Jersey Macintosh Users Group (http://www.meetup.com/NJMacUsersGroup/), which has been meeting monthly since it was founded in 1984. NJMUG is an officially recognized Apple User Group and focuses on discussions and learning about all things Apple - Macintosh computers, iPads, iPhones, Apple Watches, etc. 

So if you're looking to learn more about how to use or make better use of your iPad, iPhone, Macintosh or Apple Watch then sign up and join with us today or visit our full website at http://www.njmug.org ! Our meetings are fun, friendly, and a great source of information. I look forward to meeting you at one of our meetings!
results.name: New Jersey iPad & iPhone Users Group

results.description:
A group for Web Ops engineers, Sysadmins & other Engineers to sit, drink and swap war stories, compare current headaches, and share ideas. Non-opsy-technicals only welcome from the monthly sponsoring company. ;) 

In order for us to accept your join request, please make sure to include some brief information about your interest in ops or your sysadmin background—we are keeping this a safe space for people in our field—thanks for understanding!
results.name: Sysdrink

results.description:
This group is for people who enjoy playing guitar and singing in a casual setting.  We are also looking for singers who want to participate in the group.   It's a great chance to learn some new songs and techniques and make some friends.

The genre of music ranges from contemporary to classic rock, pop, alternative, and R&B.  You should like to play covers from the Beatles, Neil Young, Coldplay, Radiohead, Rolling Stones, U2, Foo Fighters to name a few.  We have some great songs for male and female vocalists.

The group meets at parks in Manhattan, typically downtown. When it gets cold we move to an indoor location.  We usually play in small groups of 5 - 10 players, which allows everyone to participate.  There are song lists posted on our meetup site and we encourage everyone to practice them.  Don't forget to bring your guitar straps, capos, picks, and a music stand if you have one.

You can also follow us on facebook at NYC-Acoustic-Guitar-Jam-in-the-Park/209685472536700 by liking us there.
results.name: NYC Acoustic Guitar Players and Singers Jam in the Park

results.description:
This group exists to strengthen the outdoor community in New York City.

If you organize events in the city aimed at the outdoor community, own or work for a business in the industry, or are working on a side project with the outdoor community, then join this group to network!

Is there something that you've always wanted to Organize, but never had the resources or venue to do so? Then let’s get together and talk!

Joining this Organizer Meetup Group will not only give you a chance to network with leaders in New York City, but also give you an opportunity to cross promote your events in our yearly Outdoor Rise festival and grow your group’s membership. It will give you a chance to share your knowledge and help improve our community as well.
results.name: Outdoor Rise NYC - Organizer Group

results.description:
This is a fun, casual salsa class taught by our instructor, Yrma. We meet every Saturday from 1-3. 1pm-2pm is the beginners' class and 2-3pm is the intermediate class. Classes are $12 each. We hope to see you here!

CLASSES ARE CURRENTLY ON HOLD FOR THE SUMMER! WE WILL RESUME IN THE FALL.

We provide engaging workshops lead by industry professionals with hands on learning you can apply to your marketing and advertising strategy immediately.
results.name: AdTrends: Strategy & Creative for Startups & Business Owners

results.description:
We're a small group of long-term(ish) Greenpointers who love the neighborhood and are looking to build a fun, supportive community of friends with newbies and natives. We'll drink, be active, be lazy, teach, help, learn, live.  All of that. Not all at the same time, but eventually. 

We hope to foster a wide group of friends and neighbors who enjoy each other’s company and will eventually grow comfortable supporting and helping one another out.  This type of close-knit community is a rare find in a big city and we aim to change that! 

We want to start this community by getting to know each other at happy hours, bike rides, picnics, volunteering, rideshares - you name it!... No really, we want YOU to name it:

- Looking for a lunch/happy hour buddy after you've decided you can't stare at your four walls any longer?

- Going on a Fairway/Ikea run and able to take folks along?  Are you the one that needs a ride this time around?

- Want help hauling a mid-century modern wardrobe from craigslist or have an hour to kill helping a neighbor?  

- Need technical assistance on a multi-media art project? Find a graphic designer/photographer/audio engineer in the group to help you out! 

If you nurture and build your tribe, someone WILL step up and help you.  Join us as we go about creating and building our community!
results.name: Greenpoint Friends & Neighbors

results.description: NYC Tea Enthusiasts is a group for those who have a special connection to tea, and seek to enjoy the company of other enthusiasts over a cup of quality tea. Some events will include tea parties and tastings, tea ceremonies. Always open to suggestions and ideas!
results.name: Tea-Inspired NYC

results.description:
Total 3D Experience

MyMiniFactory is equity crowdfunding with Seedrs!

3D Printing New York is for anyone interested in the revolutionary 3D technology.

Whether you are:

    a novice and would love to see a 3D printer in action,

    owner of a 3D Printer and keen to show off your creations and share your experience,

    a designer or an artist using 3D printing in your work - or keen to,

    enthusiast user of Sketchup, Blender, SolidWorks or any other 3D drawing software,

    a developer interested in new 3D modelling techniques,

    curious about making your own jewellery, kitchen tools, spare parts, glasses, fashion accessories,

    intrigued by the influence of 3D printing on the future of manufacturing,

    a chemist researching new materials for 3D printers,

    a teacher and convinced your students need to learn to design and print in 3D,

    a fashionista dedicated in creating your own trends,

    a mechanical engineer motivated by innovation to build new 3D printers,

    or just full of energy and playing with the idea of a 3D related Start-up.

No matter who you are, what skill level, 3D Printing New York is for you.

Join our group, and meet other 3D printing users, designers, bloggers, engineers, hobbyists, entrepreneurs and enthusiasts of all kinds.

Attending our meetups is a great way for all to  share projects, ideas and how-tos related to 3D printing.

Join our group for Demonstrations, Talks, Informal get togethers and other Events.
results.name: 3D Printing New York

topics.name: Executive and business coaching and mentoring

results.description: Coaches Unite!! Calling all Coaches...Business Coaches, Executive Coaches, Life Coaches and Niche Coaches. According to the 2012 ICF Global Coaching Study by Price Waterhouse Coopers: 47% of coaches collaborate, 31% barter coaching services, 54% of coaches at all stages offer pro bono coaching. So how will we form Alliances...simply...lets get to know one another. We can all be encouraged, learn and grow from one another. Network events, Coaching Circles ie. Coaching eachother (think ICF credentialing hours or enhancing your craft by learning from others), sharing some of your experiences in the marketplace (Brainstorming) and let's work in some FUN (travel, cocktails, etc)!! And if they moon and stars are aligned properly I may be able to get us a Guest Speaker. Let's build great practices, let's be the best we can be let's develop strategic alliances and let's grow our NYC Coaching Community!!!
results.name: NYC Coach to Coach - Developing Strategic Alliances

results.description:
We create opportunities for entrepreneurs and aspiring entrepreneurs to network, learn, connect and collaborate. We invite everyone to be a part of the vibrant entrepreneurial culture that is thriving in New Jersey. Our past speakers include: Carlos Dominguez (Cisco), Seth Goldman (Honest Tea), David Brancaccio (NPR's Marketplace Morning Report), Chris Welty (Google), AJ Plotkin (ff Venture Capital), John Ason (angel investor), Kathryn Swintek (Golden Seeds), Lewis Schiff (Inc.), Jeff Wald (Work Market), Ilene H. Lang (Catalyst), Kathleen Coviello (NJ EDA), Caren Franzini (formerly NJ EDA), Fran Hauser (Rothenberg Ventures), Joan Zief (Golden Seeds), Mikki Taylor (Essence Magazine), Gloria Feldt (Take the Lead), Jules Pieri (The Grommet), Zak Cassady-Dorion (Crowdfund Capital Advisors), Jonathan Sandlund (CrowdCafe.com), Kim Wales (Wales Capital and CFIRA board member), Douglas S. Ellenoff (Ellenoff Grossman & Schole LLP), Daryl Bryant (StartupValley.com). Our Meetups are held in Montclair, N.J., and include networking, a startup pitch, and 1-2 brief presentations from featured speakers. Meetups organized by the Feliciano Center for Entrepreneurship at Montclair State University.

We also host some of the region's top events at the intersection of tech and entrepreneurship, including New Jersey's only Google I/O Extended event in 2015 and 2014, through a partnership with the Google Developers Group of North Jersey.

We are in the process of creating a 3D design and printing lab - one of the largest university-based 3D printing facilities in the U.S. and one of the first housed in a school of business - that will include scores of 3D printers and several 3D scanners, and will offer rapid prototyping services for students plus the region's small and midsized manufacturing companies. We plan to hold a series of workshops so community members - in our Meetup group and beyond - can learn 3D design and printing.

Please join us if you’re an entrepreneur, aspiring entrepreneur, interested investor, or a service provider who caters to entrepreneurs.

Interested in presenting your startup? Apply here

Interested in being a featured speaker? Apply here
results.name: Montclair Entrepreneurs

results.description:
We get together every Monday to play dodgeball in Manhattan's West Village, and then every Wednesday to play on the Upper East Side - and then head out to our sponsor bar for drink deals and bar games. And you should probably come do that too, wouldn't you say?! Coed, social sports: shenanigans, tomfoolery, ballyhoo, and general smiley good time funsies all around!

Looking forward to getting to know some fresh faces, meeting good people, and playing with some new folk play in our upcoming season!

Why would you NOT want to run around like a kid, make friends, and have a beer? Inconceivable!

2 options for ya:

$10 pick-up games - show up, play around, meet new people, head to the bars! Every week!  Open for everyone 21+!

$80 season - 7 week seasons of league play: team jerseys, playoffs, play around, meet new people, head to the bars!.

_____________

THE SKINNY:

Old school rubber dodgeball is back! Just like Mr. Jameson's 3rd grade gym class - but this time, instead of going back to math class, eating mom's PB&J, and worrying about cooties - you get to go back to a bar, and drink beer, and flirt with people. Better.

We do play each other hard. Because it's fun. And fun's our favorite. Scraped knees are cool.

We do not play each other angry. Because it's dodgeball. You're not a baller. You're playing a children's game.

So come for the dodging. Stay for the drinking.

Everyone is welcome! Bring your brother! Bring your girlfriend! Bring that coworker you think is cute and want an excuse to hang out with! Bring your mom and her PB&J sandwiches!

topics.name: Bible Study in a Relaxed Atmosphere

results.description:
Are you getting bored of sticking to blind faith? Are your questions always met with abstract and hyberbolic answers?
Do you think organized religion stifles your reasoning powers?
What do the Scriptures say?
'Come now, and let us reason together, saith the LORD' (Isaiah 1:18).
Possibly the only religious book in the world that openly invites its reader to reasoning!
Join our bible study group that gladly accepts God's invitation to reason with Him and study His Word diligently!

Topics the group hopes to explore:
1. What does mankind's future look like, as per the Bible?
2. Why does God permit so much evil in the world?
3. Are science and faith mutually exclusive? Could they be reconciled with each other?
4. What has happened over 2000 years of church history and how has that changed Christianity from its original version?
5. Can the Bible be harmonized from Genesis to Revelation? Does it contradict itself anywhere?

Locations:
We meet at both New York (Manhattan) and New Jersey (Hoboken) locations. We are also open to schedule studies in other towns or suburbs in NY and NJ.

Hallmarks of the group:
1. Informal and interactive study
2. Freedom of thought and open mindedness
3. Intellectually stimulating discussions based on the Scriptures
4. No shackles of any organized religion's dogma
5. Dignified and respectful of each other's opinions
results.name: Bible Study on Deeper Questions

results.description:
Join us if you are ready to make changes in your life for the better, or perhaps just wondering if it's even possible for you or someone you care about to make important changes.

Techniques I share for FREE are easy for even toddlers to learn and use. Come to these meetups to learn how you can help yourself and others by knocking out the anxiety that underpins habits that damage our minds and bodies. You will learn to tap acupuncture points on your face, hands and body to instantly collapse panic attacks, overwhelming negative feelings, and self-sabotaging beliefs. You don't need to talk about that abusive event you survived. You don't need to re-live a disaster. Tapping works on the sub-verbal level, which is why it also works on people who cannot communicate (maybe because of a language barrier -- or maybe they're in a coma). Tapping works on infants and animals too. Sounds too good to be true? Join this group. Skeptics are my favorite people to work with because they keep me honest and are my strongest supporters when they experience this form of healing for themselves.

results.description:
Business-building through relationship-building

Welcome to the NJ Business Owners Mastermind Group!

As entrepreneurs, we *are* our businesses and we are *more* than just business. We want to get to know people better before doing business with them or referring them business. We want to connect people we know with others we know so that they can find what they need. We want to Be ourselves and let others Be themselves, in life and in business.  We want to help each other succeed.

This Community is for you if you:

• don’t really like networking events

• desire fewer, deeper conversations to initially get to know someone

• are very busy and find it hard to find the time to meet with people after a networking event

• skip networking meetings of groups you are already a member

• believe in helping others grow their business

• feel frustrated with the noise and distraction that can come with other networking venues

• are a member of other organizations but aren’t finding the business-building support you want

• have felt like you don’t “fit in” at other networking groups you’ve tried

 

Community Guidelines:

• Business cards are given upon request - not passed out like a poker hand.  :0)

• Help us know WHO you are and what you need (not only what you do) – this gathering is business building through needs discussions

• No annual membership – if you find value here, you will come back because you want to

 

This Community is *not* for you if you:

• are here to only solicit for clients/customers/team members

• aren’t interested in helping and referring community members

• are judgmental of others or closed-minded to unique business offerings

 

This group isn't your typical 'networking' event.  We are building business through building relationships, so our focus is spending time getting to know each other and our businesses better - so we can help each other succeed.

Here is an example of a typical Community gathering:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Group business needs requests (45 minutes)

6:30-7:00pm – Connection exchange (30 minutes – or longer, as space availability allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

Attendance costs $5 - you can pay here in Meetup when registering - or pay at the door.  We ask that you RSVP in advance, as we don't want to turn anyone away due to our space constraints.  Please take a moment to read "About us" at the top left so you get to know what we're all about before you RSVP.
results.name: NJ Business Owners Mastermind Group

El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores has been serving the Hell's Kitchen community since 1975. Through evening education programs, community organizing and cultural events, we help students learn new languages and participate in an exciting cultural exchange. Classes are offered in Spanish, English and Mandarin. We also offer a free Intercambio (English/Spanish language exchange) class Tuesday evenings. An all-volunteer teaching and administrative staff makes classes available at low cost. Our teachers are Native speakers and bring both a passion for teaching and a love of language into every classroom. We are located at Hartley House, a Community Center and Settlement House, serving the Clinton and Hell’s Kitchen neighborhoods since 1897.

Our classes are not wheelchair accessible. They are located on the 2nd-4th floors of a building without an elevator.

results.description:
The hype surrounding Big Data and Data Science is at a fever pitch with promises to solve the world's business and social problems, large and small. How accurate or misleading is this message? How is it helping or damaging people, and which people? What opportunities exist for data nerds and entrepreneurs that examine the larger issues with a skeptical view?

This Meetup focuses on mathematical, ethical, and business aspects of data from a skeptical perspective. Guest speakers will discuss the misuse of and best practices with data, common mistakes people make with data and ways to avoid them, how to deal with intentional gaming and politics surrounding mathematical modeling, and taking into account the feedback loops and wider consequences of modeling. We will take deep dives into models in the fields of Data Science, statistics, finance, economics, healthcare, and public policy.

This is an independent forum and open to anyone sharing an interest in the larger use of data. Technical aspects will be discussed, but attendees do not need to have a technical background.
results.name: Data Skeptics

When a community of shared values and goals come together there is an innate inspiration that happens when all energies are focused and directed together towards a common good. Many of us live below our potential and have so many dreams that we want to create...yet we sabatoge ourselves with our negative self talk. The intention of this meet up is to create a safe environment for all women who want to move forward in their lives and live their greatness as well as enjoy taking journeys of travel and adventure .  We will be exploring many varied topics including learning how to use tools for self empowerment and self improvement...make empowering choices to create the life you want to live...start responding to life rather directing it ....creating a positive mindset and using the law of attraction to manifest your dreams and goals. results.description: Itsy Bitsy Playgroup is geared towards babies from birth to 24 months old and their mothers.  Expectant moms, too!  It meets at Temple Sholom, 300 East Putnam Avenue in Greenwich, CT.  There is no cost to become a member.  Facilitated by early childhood specialist and young mom Sarah Fradkin, the discussion-and-play-group allows Jewish moms from Westchester and Fairfield counties to connect, learn from one another, and form lasting friendships.  This supportive, casual, and nurturing group meets weekly throughout the year.  Come as you are on Wednesdays anytime between 10:30 to 11:30am for conversation, music, stories, play, and periodic presentations by local infant and toddler experts.  Join us online to stay informed about special events, such as outings for moms only, parent-child sing-alongs, and celebrations for the entire family.
results.name: Itsy Bitsy Playgroup at Temple Sholom Greenwich 0-24 months

Interested in meeting early-stage Investors in the Food Industries? Then register for the FundingPost Food Investing Conference on Thursday, August 29, at the International Culinary Center in New York City! If you are an Investor, Company, Service Provider, or Member of the Press in food, restaurant, food products, food tech, restaurant tech, services, consumables or packaged goods... either on the creative side, product side or the technology that supports it, such as logistics, ordering, marketing, tracking, shipping, or sales, this is a Must-Attend event!

 

Who should attend?
* Food entrepreneurs raising capital.
* Food Investors (VCs, Angels & Corporate) to meet companies and speak on our panels.

results.description:
WELCOME DSLR and Point & Shoot photographers!  -

The group's name is being changed to CaptureTheLight - Central Jersey and it's being combined with the PhotoFusionUSA Princeton Meetup group.   PhotoFusionUSA.com will be sponsoring all the CaptureTheLight meetups nationally, meaning that it pays the dues and will give perks to it's members.  This will separate the commercial entity PhotoFusionUSA.com and help CaptureTheLight become a distinguishable social environment that Meetup.com was intended for.

To put everything into perspective, I have chosen a not-for-profit organization: MyFace.org to be the benefactor of all fees collected through CaptureTheLight meetups, less the paypal or CC transaction fees of course.

It has been my experience that when meetups are free, everyone RSVP's and only 10% show up.

I have had success in charging a stipend for events that are relatively free, like meeting at a park for a photo-walk etc.  The $5 or $10  wasn't intended to be a source of income. I regularly put that money into use for contests or paying for group dues.

Now the fees collected are justifiable, they have merit and a cause! CaptureTheLight is committed to changing the lives of many. I can not wait until the end 2015 to see how much money was raised through these efforts!

I feel compelled to ask those members who have a few spare hours a month to help by hosting some events. The more events, the more money is raised, and the more active the group is. It;s a win win for everyone!  Let's make his happen!

If you are interested in becoming an event-organizer? Contact me at John@PhotoFusionUSA.com.

PhotoFusionUSA.com is committed too! I'll be traveling nationally starting CaptureTheLight Groups to help raise awareness of MyFace.org and donating workshops as a source of fundraising.

Hang on to your hats as CaptureTheLight prepares for some exciting and rewarding events. Not just in Metuchen but in some great spots near and far.

What a great way to make new friends. Whether you're married, single, young, mature (cough cough), this group is truly the melting pot of photographers.

Photography is, of course, the main subject. If you're into Photography, join us! Bring your point-and-shoot or DSLR. Regardless of what camera you own. Photography is photography whether you shot with a cell phone or a Hasselblad.

If you are looking to get into photography professionally, then PhotoFusionUSA.com is a great source to help you achieve your goals. If you are a beginner, PhotoFusionUSA.com offers classes, workshops and private lessons.

My best regards to all,

Photography is, of course, the main subject. If you're into Photography, join us! Bring your point-and-shoot or DSLR. Regardless of what camera you own. Photography is photography whether you shot with a cell phone or a Hasselblad.

If you are looking to get into photography professionally, then PhotoFusionUSA as a great source to help you achieve your goals. If you are a beginner, PhotoFusionUSA offers classes, workshops, private lessons.

My best regards to all,

John Bodensiek, Founder
