results.description:
Our family of small business groups has over 7,200 members, inside and outside meetup, and still growing!  

We are a community-led organization supported by its members, who range from students reading business books in their dorm rooms, to entrepreneurs looking to become the next  Bill Gates, to investors in search of the next big thing, to top business experts, to established CEOs at some of New York’s top companies. Be part of a group that brings start-ups, entrepreneurs, investors and those wanting to start a business.

The group was created as an opportunity to motivate, educate and network with fellow entrepreneurs as well as mentor aspiring startups.  We have many functions such as social networking, interactive lectures, discussions, online meetups, brainstorming sessions, round table meetings, think tanks, experts panels and informative educational webinars.

Enjoy meeting new contacts for networking and/or doing business together. We have experts sharing their knowledge and many functions such as networking and discussions. You will have opportunities to meet with start-ups, entrepreneurs and investors.  Our members include seasoned professionals and anyone who has the interest and motivation to venture into the business world. The foundation of this group is to support each other in learning, growing and have fun along the way.

Come join us!... Remember in NYC is not what you know, but who you know! 

HOPE TO SEE YOU AT OUR NEXT EVENT!

Organizer: Roger Kuperways, Ph.D. Life long Entrepreneur, investor, and former adjunct Professor of Entrepreneurship at New York University. 

See us on Facebook and on our parent website http://www.businessonashoestring.com

Some requirements for members to be accepted to the group:

1) Your company has to be in business more then 1 year;

2) If you are running an accounting or tax services company, law office, real estate firm, or business consulting, then your company MUST have at least 5 regular employees;

3) Only Executive positions (CEO, Founder, Executive Director, Managing Partner, etc) will be accepted;

4) If your membership request was not approved or declined within 24 hours, it will be postponed until the next business event, where other members will vote for your approval.

More requirements are coming soon.

(Activities include coffee/ tea chats, poetry nights, live music events, volunteering, concerts, festivals, fairs, game night, movie nights, pot lucks, picnics, dinners etc)

NJ often gets a bad rap. We must break the old stereotypes that lead NJ to fall prey to punchlines. Nice does exist in NJ. We are proof of that!

Before joining ask yourself these questions:
1. Are you kind, sincere, and positive?
2. Do you do little things just to brighten someone else's day?

results.description:
Welcome to the New York City chapter of StoryForward, a group dedicated to exploring the future of storytelling and entertainment. 

We host monthly meetups, workshops, and other events celebrating the leaders, the ideas and the techniques of storytelling in the 21st Century.

StoryForward NYC is led by digital marketing director and transmedia producer, Jen Begeal, who has worked with such clients as Current TV, Verizon Fios and A&E. She is the CEO and founder of JLB Hart Media, and an adjunct professor in the New Media department at Concordia College. 

In addition to our live events we bring the community the StoryForward Podcast, hosted by Emmy Award winning Experience Designer, Steve Peters. The podcast is an extension of the StoryForward brand of properties bringing the workshops, interviews and panels from our live events to our global digital audience. 

StoryForward's mission is to connect people, curate experiences, and incubate projects from around the world. 

Please join us on our journey as we continue to educate, inspire and innovate the storytelling experience.

Welcome aboard!

results.description:
All investors, from novice to experienced, in any field of investment, must come to this meeting.

Never miss our live events. You will always be networking with the top local real estate professionals, finding various types of investment opportunities to partake in, learning something new at every meeting, & so much more!

Come out and meet the right connections through this savvy investor networking group. These entrepreneurs are focused on building wealth through cash flow rental income in commercial, apartment, multifamily, and residential properties, including distressed assets and foreclosures.

You will learn how to network, find private money, create opportunities, and learn how to put deals together the right way. Allow us to get you focused on the beginning and advanced strategies of how to start and run a profitable real estate investment business.

You will learn how to uncover the best opportunities in the hotel, apartment building and commercial markets across the country, and also properties local to our metropolitan area. You'll have a forum in New York City for real estate investors to joint venture together. You will learn what you've been taught wrong and get the information you need to correct it.

Your hosts started investing before "guru" hit the real estate lexicon. You'll get to exchange and discuss differing investor perspectives and share the successful strategies the leadership team has been applying successfully over the past 45+ years in every real estate transaction strategy.

Connect now on Meetup to find out about your next roundtable dialogue session, locate our live meetings all over New York, and learn what you need to know to actually make money in Real Estate.

In addition, you will get invites to all private networking events, brainstorming sessions, and presentations to discuss strategies and current investment deals.

Have you been using a particular strategy that has been very profitable for you and want to offer it to the group? Email or call us today and we will make it happen at one of our sub-group meetings. Do you have a real estate related question on any topic and need a solution? Call us now and get your help from the leadership team free.

All our networking meetings are free. If we must pay for a location, we will tell you what the cost is and ask for donations from the attendees.

results.description:
The quick summary:

  • For casual runners looking to meet new people and get some exercise in
  • Runs schedule 7-10PM on weekdays, 11AM-8PM on weekends
  • For now, the majority of runs will take place in Manhattan, but I am looking for co-organizers interested in scheduling runs in other boroughs

_______________________________________________

Hi all. I am creating this group because I am interested in running more. My interest in running and creating this group stems from:

  • Wanting more consistent exercise
  • Wanting to meet new people and socialize, during and outside of workouts (happy hour anyone?)
  • Realizing every other group has runs at 6-8AM or 4-6PM! I am not a morning person, and I work late. Runs will be targeted to after 7PM on weekdays and 11AM-8PM on weekends.

So the goal of this group is to be a casual running group for those who are just looking to get a run in during the week. If the group grows, I'll schedule more frequent runs to accommodate everyone's demand and schedule. My pace for runs of 1-3 miles is usually about 10min/mile. Hoping to get that to improve, but the point is, this group is for people who are not serious athletes looking to compete. That being said, we might look into some 5K's for fun... but that will be optional for whichever members are interested.

Also, I encourage members to take the lead and schedule runs so we can cover different neighborhoods, fitness levels, and schedules. If you are interested, let me know and I can make you an event organizer.

Hoping to see you charmers* out there!


* Can I Have Another Running Meetup?

(It took me like 5 days to come up with that)
results.name: Not So Serious Running Group

This will be done through playgroups and family outings. We hope to build upon this based on the needs of the group.
results.name: Adoptive Families Playgroup of Fairfield County

results.description:
CALLING ALL CABARET LOVERS! If you thrill to intimate performance art - music, theater, burlesque, dance, satire, magic, improv and spoken word, you've found IT. No matter what side of the footlights you prefer, stage or audience, if you thrill to the intimacy of cabaret and salon, and the variety of venues from living room to concert hall, this Meetup is for YOU. Join us for:

* Salon-style social gatherings

* Outings to live performance events

* Open circle presentations - my version of open mics - for a variety of disciplines.

* Workshops for everyone from novices who dream of being in front of an audience, to part-time dabblers who want to keep their skills honed or are returning to performance after a long break, to working professionals who want to dig more deeply into technique and presentation.

 

HOW THE GROUP GOT ITS NAME. Cabaret means intimacy. Connection. The entertaining of big ideas and big emotions in small spaces.

It's origin is in the French word for wine cellar or tavern and was born 132 years ago when Paris was the glittering capitol of the world.

Cabaret exploded in 1920s and 30s Berlin to encompass song, spoken word, poetry, satire, juggling, pantomime, dance, burlesque, magic, and more, and that's where it got its name, "die Zehnte Muse." The ancient muses and daughters of Zeus, you see, each had their domain in the arts. A new patron goddess was needed to join her sisters. Cabaret was her name. Cabaret, the Tenth Muse.


Today cabaret can be experienced across the globe. Here in NYC, it is experiencing a renaissance. I've been championing the roots of the artform for 18 years as singer-actress, producer and director.


When I discovered cabaret's fantastic history, flexibility and diversity, I made music my career. My own song has led me to merging many musical styles, eras and languages. Organizing the Tenth Muse Meetup is an exciting step along the way!

WILLKOMMEN * BIENVENUE * WELCOME * WELKOMM * BIENVENIDO * BENVENUTO * BOAS-VINDAS * BARUKH HABA * SVAGATA * SELAMAT DATANG * AHLA W SAHLA * ARIBU * KANGEI * ALOHA


Artists featured: Theo Bleckmann, KT Sullivan, Kurt Valentin, Kim Smith, Meow Meow, Jean Brassard, Karen Kohler, Marni Rice
results.name: Tenth Muse Cabaret Meetup - New York City

results.description: Want to learn more about music technology? Want to meet other music technology educators and share ideas? Join us at NYU for a three-hour meetup where we will share strategies for integrating music technology into music learning and teaching experiences, explore a variety of new and emerging music technologies, self-organize into different interest groups, and engage in hands-on experiences sharing and exploring music technology across a wide range of educational contexts. We especially welcome educators and college students, community music instructors, and private music teachers, as well as entrepreneurs and coders developing apps and tools for the music and education space.

results.description:
This group runs from late fall to early spring each year.

As it's now beyond early spring, we don't have any games scheduled.

Please join the group so that you can be informed of when and where we'll be starting up again - in late fall 2014!

In the meantime, here's a brief description of the group:

This group is for adults who want to play pick-up and/or league indoor soccer - and to support a great local cause at the same time (i.e., a soccer league for NYC's under-served students - see www.nyisl.com).

We play indoor three times a week (Tuesdays, Wednesdays & Thursdays) from 7-10:30pm.

To play just for fun and fitness, you can RSVP for our 'drop-in' (i.e., pick-up) sessions on this group's home page.

To play more competitive soccer, you can sign up your team (or you can join an existing team) by clicking here.

All proceeds from the 'drop-in' soccer and our established, award-winning league go to the NYISL, which is run under a non-profit program with 501c3 status. Accordingly, we also accept tax-deductible donations.

If you don't want to pay each time you play 'drop-in' soccer, you can make a one-time donation and play in all our pick-up groups, in all our locations (Brooklyn, Manhattan and Queens) for one entire year. Suggested tax-deductible donation: $100.

If you want to join our Brooklyn and Queens outdoor pick-up group, click here.

Hope to see you on the floor or pitch soon!

Best,

Greg
results.name: NY Indoor Soccer (for Social Change)

results.description: The NYC Android Live Code meetups are designed to be interactive, educational and fun events. No lanyards. No discussion panels. This meetup is 100% about making and learning Android framework code goodness. The format: We'll have a superstar coder build an Android project in real time on stage. The audience is invited to participate with questions, input and debugging. Grab a drink and some snacks, watch the magic happen on the screen, and call out your questions and suggestions. We will be looking into bringing in some swag, keep an eye on the upcoming events.
